titleStmt.title: Cambridge, Cambridge University Library, MS Add.1146

respStmt.resp: Edited by Michael Marx in collaboration with Tobias J. Jocham et. al. TEI version created by Yasmin Faghihi and Huw Jones

availability.p: Image credits: University of Cambridge, UK.

summary.p: 2 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Add. 1146; Qurʾānic text: Q 33:52-34:11; 21 Lines per page; Dimensions: 343 x 422mm Script style: kūfī B.Ib.

Fragments of an Abbasid Qurʼān probably written in the second or third century A.H. / eighth or ninth century A.D., containing verses from Sura al-Aḥzāb (سورة الأحزاب) and Sura Sabaʾ (سورة سبا). The script seems to correspond to the Abbasid Style B.Ia or B.Ib as described by F. Deroche. For more information about the manuscript, see the entry in the Digital Library of Cambridge University.

The University of Cambridge acquired the fragment in 1878 from Edward H. Palmer (1840-1882) and E.E. Tyrwhitt Drake. The displayed fragment and other early Qur'an manuscripts (call numbers Add. 1115 - Add. 1150) were acquired by Palmer during a research trip to the Sinai Peninsula (cf. Ansorge 2016).

The fragments Arabe 6140 (b) (Paris, 4 fol.) and 1-85-154.101 (Library of Congress, Washington D.C., 1 fol.) probably originate from the same codex. Interestingly, another fragment from the library of Cambridge University (Add. 1125) belongs to the same codex as another fragment from the collective manuscript Arabe 6140, namely Arabe 6140 (a).

l.note: diacritics of the „t“ are hard to read
Abdǧad ص | darüber wurde die Versnummer nachgetragen
Abdǧad ع | darüber wurde die Versnummer nachgetragen
Abdǧad ى | darüber wurde die Versnummer nachgetragen | ٱعۡمَلۡ
